se.fredin.jayplayer.domain

Class Track

  • java.lang.Object
    • se.fredin.jayplayer.domain.Track
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    MockTrack

    public class Track
extends java.lang.Object
    Creates a Media object and assings it to a MediaPlayer object. Contains methods for playing, stopping, volume as well as manipulating playback rate and balance.
    Author:
    johan

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      Track(java.lang.String path)
      Default constructor.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Track

        public Track(java.lang.String path)
        Default constructor. Takes a path and assigns it to a Media object. If necessary the path is manipulated to fit the syntax javafx uses. This is required when loading a local music file.
        Parameters:
        path - The absolute path to where the music file is located.

    • Method Detail

      • getPath

        public java.lang.String getPath()
        Gets the path to the media file
        Returns:
        The path to the media file

      • getTitle

        public java.lang.String getTitle()
        Retrieves the title from the path by cutting it out. It's pretty low level but it works!
        Returns:
        The title of the media file

      • play

        public void play(java.lang.Runnable r)
        Plays the music file.
        Parameters:
        r - A runnable responsible for what to do when the track is finished playing.

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stops playing the music file.

      • setBalance

        public void setBalance(float balance)
        Sets the balance of the music file. Ranges from -1.0 to 1.0. Default is 0.0 e.g stereo
        Parameters:
        balance - the balance

      • setPlayBackRate

        public void setPlayBackRate(float playBackRate)
        Sets the playback rate for the media file e.g speeds it up or slows it down. Ranges from 0.0 to 8.0. Default is 1.0
        Parameters:
        playBackRate - the playback rate

      • setVolume

        public void setVolume(float volume)
        Sets the volume for the media file. ranges from 0.0 to 1.0. Default is 1.0.
        Parameters:
        volume - the volume

      • getVolume

        public double getVolume()
        Gets the volume for the media file.
        Returns:
        the volume

      • getCurrentTime

        public double getCurrentTime()
        Gets the current time in minutes.
        Returns:
        current time in minutes

      • getTotalTime

        public double getTotalTime()
        Gets the total time of the media file in minutes
        Returns:
        the total time in minutes

      • wasPlayed

        public boolean wasPlayed()
        Gets if the media file was played or not
        Returns:
        was media played

      • setWasPlayed

        public void setWasPlayed(boolean wasPlayed)
        Sets if the media was played or not.
        Parameters:
        wasPlayed - was the media played

      • isPlaying

        public boolean isPlaying()
        Gets the status on the media file playing
        Returns:
        is the media file playing
